definitions:
to turn a certain age (usually succeeded by los)


Cumplí los 18 años el mes pasado.

I turned 18 last month.




Ella vivía con sus padres hasta que cumplió 20 años.

She lived with her parents until she turned 20.
description: cumplir (first-person singular present cumplo, first-person singular preterite cumplí, past participle cumplido)
etymology: From Old Spanish cumplir, complir, from Latin complēre, present active infinitive of compleō (however, the preservation of the -pl-, in comparison to henchir from implēre, indicates the word did not completely undergo a popular phonetic evolution, and a more conservative pronunciation was preserved, probably due to use among the learned upper classes[1]). Compare Portuguese cumprir.
